body_html:
Yes, the documentation is lacking (and yes, it was lame to name an op self_adjoint and then not support complex - I filed an appropriately snarky meme for that a while ago). Feel free to send a PR to add support for complex. You would simply need to add the kernel registrations for complex types here:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/kernels/self_adjoint_eig_v2_op.cc#L85

and update the unit tests here:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/self_adjoint_eig_op_test.py

You can look at svd_op* as an example.

body:
Yes, the documentation is lacking (and yes, it was lame to name an op self_adjoint and then not support complex - I filed an appropriately snarky meme for that a while ago). Feel free to send a PR to add support for complex. You would simply need to add the kernel registrations for complex types here: 

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/kernels/self_adjoint_eig_v2_op.cc#L85

and update the unit tests here:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/self_adjoint_eig_op_test.py

You can look at svd_op\* as an example.
